exhibition_title: Crossing the Channel: British and French Painting in the Age of Romanticism
exhibition_description: This exhibition explored the relationship between French and British painting during the 1820s and 1830s when fascination with every level of Anglo-Scottish culture played a formative role in the development of modern French art. Approximately 120 paintings by 60 artists, including Turner, Bonington, Constable, Delacroix, GÃ©ricault, and Corot were on view. An exhibition catalogue accompanied the exhibition.
